sectionText: 3 hours. Field expedition to Costa Rica over spring break (approx. 9 days), and weekly seminar.  The course will use Costa Rica as a case study to examine environment and sustainability issues. Topics includes: rainforest ecology, land-use issues, sustainable agriculture, global versus local economies, and  geologic features of the landscape (e.g., volcanoes; rivers).  Students will be responsible for the field trip expenses in the amount of $2727.    Prerequisite: For ESES majors and Unit One Living Learning Community Students. Non majors can apply to the waitlist.
